meanings.definition: One who assumes something to be true without evidence.
meanings.sent1: The assumers in the group believed the rumor without checking the facts.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reminded the class not to be assumers and to always ask questions.
meanings.sent3: The assumers thought the treasure map was real, leading them on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: She was an assumer, seeing danger where there was only peace.
meanings.sent5: The assumers jumped to conclusions, causing unnecessary panic.

meanings.definition: Those who take on a particular role or responsibility without being asked.
meanings.sent1: The assumers volunteered to help clean up the park after the event.
meanings.sent2: The assumers stepped up to lead the team when the captain was absent.
meanings.sent3: The assumers decided to start a book club without waiting for approval.
meanings.sent4: She was an assumer, always ready to lend a hand without being asked.
meanings.sent5: The assumers took charge and organized the charity event on their own.

meanings.definition: The act of taking on a belief or idea without proof.
meanings.sent1: The assumers quickly embraced the new theory without questioning its validity.
meanings.sent2: Her assumers about the situation led her to make hasty decisions.
meanings.sent3: The assumers about aliens visiting Earth made for an entertaining conversation.
meanings.sent4: She was an assumer, adopting new trends without hesitation.
meanings.sent5: The assumers of the urban legend spread the story like wildfire.
